record.description: Named in honor of the Flint, Michigan, automotive pioneer and philanthropist, the $1,300,000 Charles Stewart Mott Building is the new home of the University of Chicago's Industrial Relations Center. Dedication ceremonies will be held Friday, June 26, and university chancellor Lawrence A. Kimpton will accept the keys to the new building. The Industrial Relations Center will serve both the business and academic communities.
